verses.roman:
'kāhāṅre rāvṇā' prabhu kahe krodhāveśe
jagan-mātā hare pāpī, mārimu savaṁśe'

synonyms: kāhāṅre rāvṇā—where is the rascal Rāvaṇa; prabhu—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; kahe—says; krodha-āveśe—in great anger; jagat-mātā—the mother of the universe; hare—kidnaps; pāpī—sinful; mārimu—I shall kill; sa-vaṁśe—with all his family.
translation: In the ecstasy of Hanumān, Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu angrily said, "Where is the rascal Rāvaṇa? He has kidnapped the universal mother, Sītā. Now I shall kill him and all his family."
